action.action-desc: Mr. Green of Texas introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To establish an Office of Fair Lending Testing to test for compliance with the Equal Credit Opportunity Act, to strengthen the Equal Credit Opportunity Act, to ensure that persons injured by discriminatory practices, including organizations that have diverted resources to address discrimination and whose mission has been frustrated by illegal acts, can seek relief under such Act and to provide for criminal penalties for violating such Act, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Fair Lending for All Act.

subsection.text: There is established within the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection an Office of Fair Lending Testing (hereinafter referred to as the Office).
The head of the Office shall be a Director, who shall—

paragraph.text: be appointed to a 5-year term by, and report to, the Director of the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection;
appoint and fix the compensation of such employees as are necessary to carry out the duties of the Office under this section; and
provide an estimated annual budget to the Director of the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection.

subsection.text: The position of the Director shall be a career position within the civil service.

paragraph.text: The Office, in consultation with the Attorney General and the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development, shall conduct testing of compliance with the Equal Credit Opportunity Act by creditors, through the use of individuals who, without any bona fide intent to receive a loan, pose as prospective borrowers for the purpose of gathering information.

If, in carrying out the testing described under paragraph (1), the Office believes a person has violated the Equal Credit Opportunity Act, the Office shall refer such violation in writing to the Attorney General for appropriate action.

subsection.text: Section 707 of the Equal Credit Opportunity Act (15 U.S.C. 1691f) is amended by adding at the end the following: In addition, each report of the Bureau shall include an analysis of the testing carried out pursuant to section 2 of the Fair Lending for All Act, and each report of the Bureau and the Attorney General shall include a summary of criminal enforcement actions taken under section 706A..
Subsection (a) of section 701 of the Equal Credit Opportunity Act (15 U.S.C. 1691) is amended to read as follows:
It shall be unlawful to discriminate against any person, with respect to any aspect of a credit transaction—

paragraph.text: on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, sex (including sexual orientation and gender identity), marital status, or age (provided the applicant has the capacity to contract);
on the basis of the person’s ZIP Code, or census tract;
because all or part of the person's income derives from any public assistance program; or
because the person has in good faith exercised any right under the Consumer Credit Protection Act.

subsection.header: Removal of certain references to creditors and applicants and definition added
subsection.text: The Equal Credit Opportunity Act (15 U.S.C. 1691 et seq.) is amended—

paragraph.text: in section 701(b)—

subparagraph.text: by striking applicant each place such term appears and inserting person; and
in paragraph (2), by striking applicant’s each place such term appears and inserting person’s;

paragraph.text: in section 702—

subparagraph.text: by redesignating subsection (g) as subsection (h); and
by inserting after subsection (f) the following:

subsection.text: The term aggrieved person includes any person who—

paragraph.text: claims to have been injured by a discriminatory credit practice; or
believes that such person will be injured by a discriminatory credit practice.
in section 704A—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (b)(1), by striking applicant each place such term appears and inserting aggrieved person; and
in subsection (c), by striking applicant and inserting aggrieved person;

paragraph.text: in section 705—

subparagraph.text: by striking the applicant each place such term appears and inserting persons; and

clause.text: by striking a creditor to take and inserting taking; and
by striking applicant and inserting person; and

paragraph.text: in section 706—

subparagraph.text: by striking creditor each place such term appears and inserting person;
by striking creditor’s each place such term appears and inserting person’s;
by striking creditors each place such term appears and inserting persons; and
in subsection (f), by striking applicant and inserting aggrieved person.

section.header: Criminal penalties for violations of the Equal Credit Opportunity Act

subsection.text: The Equal Credit Opportunity Act (15 U.S.C. 1691 et seq.) is amended by inserting after section 706 the following:
Any person who knowingly and willfully violates this title shall be fined not more than $50,000, or imprisoned not more than 1 year, or both.

paragraph.text: Any person who engages in a pattern or practice of knowingly and willfully violating this title shall be fined not more than $100,000 for each violation of this title, or imprisoned not more than twenty years, or both.

paragraph.header: Personal liability of executive officers and directors of the board
paragraph.text: Any executive officer or director of the board of an entity who knowingly and willfully causes the entity to engage in a pattern or practice of knowingly and willfully violating this title (or who directs another agent, senior officer, or director of the entity to commit such a violation or engage in such acts that result in the director or officer being personally unjustly enriched) shall be—

subparagraph.text: fined in an amount not to exceed 100 percent of the compensation (including stock options awarded as compensation) received by such officer or director from the entity—

clause.text: during the time period in which the violations occurred; or
in the one to three year time period preceding the date on which the violations were discovered; and

subparagraph.text: imprisoned for not more than 5 years.

subsection.text: The table of contents for the Equal Credit Opportunity Act (15 U.S.C. 1691 et seq.) is amended by inserting after the item relating to section 706 the following:
Subtitle C of the Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 (12 U.S.C. 5531 et seq.) is amended by adding at the end the following:

The Bureau shall carry out reviews of loan applications and the process of taking loan applications being used by covered persons to ensure such applications and processes do not violate the Equal Credit Opportunity Act or any other Federal consumer financial law.

If the Bureau determines under subsection (a) that any loan application or process of taking a loan application violates the Equal Credit Opportunity Act or any other Federal consumer financial law, the Bureau shall—

paragraph.text: prohibit the covered person from using such application or process; and
take such enforcement or other actions with respect to the covered person as the Bureau determines appropriate.

subsection.text: The table of contents in section 1 of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act is amended by inserting after the item relating to section 1037 the following:

Section 304(b)(4) of the Home Mortgage Disclosure Act of 1975 (12 U.S.C. 2803(b)(4)) is amended by striking census tract, income level, racial characteristics, age, and gender and inserting the applicant or borrower’s ZIP Code, census tract, income level, race, color, religion, national origin, sex, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, and age.
Section 304(h)(3)(A) of the Home Mortgage Disclosure Act of 1975 (12 U.S.C. 2803(h)(3)(A)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in clause (i), by striking and at the end;
by redesignating clause (ii) as clause (iii); and
by inserting after clause (i) the following:

clause.text: ZIP Code, census tract, and any other category of data described in subsection (b)(4), as the Bureau determines to be necessary to satisfy the purpose described in paragraph (1)(E), and in a manner consistent with that purpose; and
